title: Maki Haneta
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player. She played for <a href="Japan%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a>.
Club career.
Haneta was born on 30 September 1972. She played for <a href="Speranza%20Osaka-Takatsuki">Matsushita Electric Panasonic Bambina</a>. In <a href="1994%20L.League">1994 season</a>, the club won <a href="L.League">L.League</a> championship and she was selected MVP awards. She was also selected Best Eleven 4 times (<a href="1993%20L.League">1993</a>, <a href="1994%20L.League">1994</a>, <a href="1996%20L.League">1996</a> and <a href="1998%20L.League">1998</a>).
National team career.
In December 1993, Haneta was selected <a href="Japan%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a> for <a href="1993%20AFC%20Women%27s%20Championship">1993 AFC Championship</a>. At this competition, on 4 December, she debuted and scored a goal against <a href="Chinese%20Taipei%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Chinese Taipei</a>. She also played at <a href="Football%20at%20the%201994%20Asian%20Games">1994 Asian Games</a> and <a href="1995%20AFC%20Women%27s%20Championship">1995 AFC Championship</a>. She was a member of Japan for <a href="1995%20FIFA%20Women%27s%20World%20Cup">1995 World Cup</a> and <a href="Football%20at%20the%201996%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%20tournament">1996 Summer Olympics</a>. She played 30 games and scored 1 goal for Japan until 1997.
